column1: Is Everything Going According to Plan? Expectations in Goal Reasoning Agents
Senior Member Presentation Track Papers: Summary Talks
In part motivated by topics such as agency safety
column2: there is an increasing interest in goal reasoning
column3: a form of agency where the agents formulate their own goals. One of the crucial aspects of goal reasoning agents is their ability to detect if the execution of their courses of actions meet their own expectations. We present a taxonomy of different forms of expectations as used by goal reasoning agents when monitoring their own execution. We summarize and contrast the current understanding of how to define and check expectations based on different knowledge sources used. We also identify gaps in our understanding of expectations.
